Cairo had raised fears that the country could suffer the same loss of cultural heritage as occurred in Iraq in 2003 after the fall of Saddam Hussein . Egypt's cultural treasures are now secure, Zahi Hawass said. The Valley of the Kings is safe, the pyramids are safe, 24 museums are safe, the synagogues and the monasteries and the Muslim monuments are completely safe, he said.

Trade unions and politicians have already accused Sergio Marchionne of`` blackmail'' in pushing through a tough deal on working conditions at Fiat's flagship Mirafiori plant in Turin to save the factory from closure. Fiat is a great multinational which is growing in the world but its heart remains Italian, Industry Minister Paolo Romani said Saturday, adding,`` All arguments are now closed. Romanni had said Monday that he would be asking Sergio Marchionne `` to commit to investing in our country and remain with head and heart'' in Italy.
